div.p: Greetings. I have added these few things to Mr. Cognetius's letter, by which you will know that, by the grace of God, I am well and wish you very much health. This one new thing is written to me: the Queen of Scotland, with the help of certain nobles, has escaped from the prison where she was detained and fled to a well-fortified town, where she awaits assistance. That Flemish tumult seems to me to have neither head nor tail so far; yet it is hardly likely that such a dark cloud will pass without consequence.
Farewell. Mr. Gwalter here will know that I wish him very much health. Farewell again.
To the most distinguished man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, pastor of the Church of Zürich.
